an4.26:4.1: “Mendicants, those mendicants who are deceivers, stubborn, flatterers, frauds, insolent, and scattered: they are no mendicants of mine.
an4.26:4.2: They’ve left this teaching and training, and they don’t achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
an4.26:4.3: But those mendicants who are genuine, not flatterers, stable, amenable, and collected: they are mendicants of mine.
an4.26:4.4: They haven’t left this teaching and training,
an4.26:4.5: and they achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.”
an4.26:5.1: “Those who are deceivers, stubborn, flatterers, and frauds,
an4.26:5.3: these don’t grow in the teaching
an4.26:5.4: that was taught by the perfect Buddha.
an4.26:6.1: But those who are genuine, not flatterers, stable
an4.26:6.3: these do grow in the teaching
an4.26:6.4: that was taught by the perfect Buddha.”
